text: Julius Wagner-Jauregg (7 March 1857 â€“ 27 September 1940) was an Austrian doctor. He won the 1927 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his discovery that malaria inoculation helps the treatment of paralysis. ==References== Category:1857 births Category:1940 deaths Category:Austrian scientists Category:Austrian Nobel Prize winners Category:Austrian physicians
